bug.author: Charlie-lusie
bug.summary: Help! I can not get full LiDAR points in one frame of data
bug.description:
As shown in figure below, I set the LiDAR sensor config correctly: <denchmark-code> sensors_bp['lidar']=[blueprint.find('sensor.lidar.ray_cast'),carla.Location(x=1.0,z=4.0)] sensors_bp['lidar'][0].set_attribute('rotation_frequency','10') sensors_bp['lidar'][0].set_attribute('channels','16')
</denchmark-code>
But I can't get full points at once. It looks like data is generated in half of a full circle: <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10813880/82818683-a9106980-9ed1-11ea-8194-af4cf22732ba.png></denchmark-link>

comments.comment: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/joel-mb>@joel-mb</denchmark-link> <denchmark-link:https://github.com/fpasch>@fpasch</denchmark-link> could this be a problem in our interface with rviz?
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/Charlie-lusie>@Charlie-lusie</denchmark-link> Please ensure, that the rotation frequency equals the fixed_delta_seconds specified in carla_ros_bridge.

@Charlie-lusie Please ensure, that the rotation frequency equals the fixed_delta_seconds specified in carla_ros_bridge.
I set the rotation frequency = 10Hz, and all params in carla_ros_bridge is default. But I fixed the problem by running: python config.py --fps=10
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/sergi-e>@sergi-e</denchmark-link> before closing this issue, could you reflect this in the documentation, please?
